required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Clinical Utility of Measuring the Circadian Clock in Treatment of Delayed Sleep-Wake Phase Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: The Clinical Utility of DLMO in the Treatment of Delayed Sleep-Wake Phase Disorder: A Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test whether measuring the circadian clock during treatment of delayed sleep-wake phase disorder results in greater improvements in sleep compared to estimating the circadian clock.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a randomized, controlled, parallel double-blind 4-week trial of 0.5 mgs of exogenous melatonin timed to either 3 h before actual dim light melatonin onset (DLMO) based on in-home measurement (M-DLMO, n = 25) or 3 h before DLMO estimated at 2 h before average sleep onset time based on actigraphy and sleep diary (E-DLMO, n = 25) in adult participants with delayed sleep-wake phase disorder. All participants will receive melatonin 0.5 mgs. Outcomes include change in DLMO, subjective and objective sleep parameters, and daytime symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Time of Dim Light Melatonin Onset (DLMO) at 4 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Onset of melatonin in dim light conditions as measured in saliva (also called DLMO). Time of DLMO is measured in clock time, so a positive number in change would represent a later onset of melatonin and a negative number represents an earlier onset of melatonin

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Score on Sleep Diary Parameters at 4 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Total sleep time, initial sleep latency, sleep onset time, sleep offset time per self-report.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Score on Wrist Actigraphy Sleep Parameters at 4 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Total sleep time, initial sleep latency, sleep onset time, sleep offset time per wrist actigraphy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Score on Epworth Sleepiness Scale at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of daytime sleepiness. Scores range from 0 to 24. Scores of 10 or higher indicate excessive daytime sleepiness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Score on Multidimensional Fatigue Inventory at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of daytime fatigue. Scores range from 20-100; higher scores indicate more fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Score on Sheehan Disability Scale at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of functional impairment in works/school, social, and family life. Scores range from 0-30; higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Score on Patient Health Questionnaire-9 at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of depression symptoms. Scores range from 0-27; higher scores indicate more severe depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Score on Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7 Scale at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of generalized anxiety symptoms. Scores range from 0-21; higher scores indicate more severe anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Score on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of sleep quality. Seven subscale scores are summed to obtain a global score. Global scores range from 0 to 21; scores of 5 or higher indicate poor sleep quality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Score on the Insomnia Severity Index at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of insomnia symptoms. Scores range from 0 to 28; scores of 14 or higher indicate clinically significant insomnia symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Score on the Morningness Eveningness Questionnaire at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of chronotype. Scores range from 16-86. Lower scores indicate more eveningness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Score on the PROMIS-Sleep Disturbance Scale at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of sleep disturbances. Scores range from 8-40. Higher scores indicate greater sleep disturbance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Score on the PROMIS-Sleep Related Impairment Scale at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of impairment related to sleep. Scores range from 8-40. Higher scores indicate greater impairment due to sleep.

arm_group.description: Four weeks (28 days) of nightly melatonin 0.5 mg fast dissolve tablets timed to be administered 3 hours before estimated dim light melatonin onset.
Four weeks (28 days) of nightly melatonin 0.5 mg fast dissolve tablets timed to be administered 3 hours before measured dim light melatonin onset.

intervention.description: Test to determine the time of melatonin onset in saliva under dim light conditions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meet diagnostic criteria for delayed sleep wake phase disorder
- Female participants of childbearing potential must agree to use a reliable method of contraception from the screening visit until 4 weeks after the study has completed.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypersensitivity to melatonin or any other component of the product
- Sleep disorder other than delayed sleep wake phase disorder
- Medical and psychiatric conditions that may influence sleep or be affected by melatonin
- Current use of medications which may have interactions with melatonin
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
- Routine night shift work
- Past month travel or planned travel during the study across more than one time zone
- Use of melatonin in the past month
- Current use of medications that may interfere with the measurement of melatonin
